title: Marvel 'are being sued' as its claimed they STOLE X-Men theme song from 1980s Hungarian TV show
text:
Marvel are being sued by a man in Hungary who claims the X-Men animated series from the 90s stole their popular theme song.

According to TMZ, Zoltan Krisko is suing several other media companies including FOX, Apple, Disney and Amazon, claiming TV executives ripped off the theme song to X-Men: The Animated Series from an earlier programme called Linda.

Linda was a Hungarian crime-comedy series that aired from 1984 to 1991 and Mr Krisko manages the estate of Hungarian composer Gyorgy Vukan who created and copyrighted the Linda theme song.

Legal: Marvel are being sued by a man in Hungary who claims the X-Men animated series from the 90s stole their popular theme song (pictured in X-Men: The Last Stand)

In his lawsuit, Krisko claims TV executives behind the X-Men animated show rubbed shoulders with Hungarian film professionals in the 80s.

He suggests this would have led them to hearing the Linda theme song as it was such a popular show during this period.

The X-Men animated series debuted in the US in 1992 on FOX and aired for five seasons.

Krisko said he was not aware of the TV series or its theme song until 2017 but claims that much of the success the franchise has had in subsequent years is due to its theme song.

Claims: In his lawsuit, Krisko claims TV executives behind the X-Men animated show rubbed shoulders with Hungarian film professionals in the 80s and would have heard the song

According to the publication, he now wants Gyorgy Vukan's estate to receive some of the profits the franchise has made since the 90s.

MailOnline has contacted a representative for Marvel for comment.

As well as the 90s animated series, the X-Men franchise spans 12 live-action films and another to be released next year, several video games, another animated series and the original comic books.

The X-Men film series is the seventh highest-grossing film series of all time, having grossed over $6billion worldwide and is set to conclude with the release of The New Mutants in 2020.

The highest grossing film in the series was 2018's Deadpool 2 which made $785million while the lowest was this year's Dark Phoenix which made just $252million against a $200million budget.
